The concept of scarcity would no longer exist, as people would be able to access all resources they need without worrying about financial limitations.
Without money, society would have a more equitable distribution of wealth and resources, as there would be no wealthy individuals hoarding vast amounts of wealth for themselves.
The economy would likely function differently, as businesses would have to rely on other forms of exchange, such as bartering or gift-giving, rather than exchanging goods and services for money.
The concept of ownership would change, as people would not be able to buy and sell things, but instead have access to them as needed.
The social fabric of society would change, as people would have to rely on each other for support and resources, rather than relying on institutions like banks and governments.
